titles.title: Affirming the nature and importance of the support of the United States for the religious and ethnic minority survivors of genocide in Iraq.
Affirming the nature and importance of the support of the United States for the religious and ethnic minority survivors of genocide in Iraq.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Mr. Moylan moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 554.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Foreign Affairs
committee.activity: Markup By, Markup By, Referred To

term.name: War crimes, genocide, crimes against humanity

bill.summary: This resolution affirms that the fundamental human right and dignity of the religious and ethnic minority communities of Iraq should be a policy priority of the United States and the international community.
